meanings.definition: Falling off or dropping early, as petals or teeth.
meanings.sent1: The caducous petals of the flower fell to the ground in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent2: The tree's caducous leaves covered the ground in a colorful carpet during autumn.
meanings.sent3: The caducous petals played a game of 'fall and seek' with the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her caducous smile faded away as quickly as the morning dew.
meanings.sent5: The caducous nature of childhood memories makes them all the more precious.

meanings.definition: Shedding at an early stage of development.
meanings.sent1: The caducous feathers of the baby bird were a sign of its youth.
meanings.sent2: The lizard's caducous tail detached easily when threatened by a predator.
meanings.sent3: The caducous baby teeth were eagerly awaited by the Tooth Fairy.
meanings.sent4: His caducous interest in the new toy faded quickly as he moved on to the next.
meanings.sent5: The caducous innocence of childhood is a precious and fleeting time.

meanings.sent1: The caducous snow sculptures melted under the warm sun.
meanings.sent2: His caducous enthusiasm for the project waned as time passed.
meanings.sent3: The caducous nature of the sandcastle made it a temporary masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her caducous anger dissipated as quickly as it had flared up.
meanings.sent5: The caducous beauty of the sunset painted the sky in fleeting colors.
